text:
Sworn to and subscribed
before me this the 29th. day
of May AD 1879
"L S"
William C Braman
Joseph Nolte JP &
Ex Officio N P M Co
417
Filed at 11 Oclock A M May 29th. 1879
Recorded at 4 Oclock P M May 29" 1879
John L Croom Clk C C M Co.
By S Rugeley Deputy.
No. 8272 Antonette Roberts To Wm. C Braman.
deed to part of Dempsy League
The State of Texas
Washington County I Know all men by these presents that I Antonette Roberts,
formerly Antonette Power of of the above named State & County for and in
consideration of the sum of Fifty dollars to me in hand paid by Wm. C Braman
of the County of Matagorda in said State the receipt whereof is hereby acknowledged
and for other valuable considerations by me received have granted bargained sold
& conveyed & by these presents do grant bargain sell alienate convey & confirm
unto him the said William C Braman, his heirs & assigns forever, all of the
following described tract of land to wit. Fourteen hundred & Twenty eight acres
of land situated in said Matagorda County being a part of F W Dempsey league
on the east side of the Colorado River, bounded as follows on the Westerly end
by said River, on the easterly end by the S Ingram league, on the on the Northerly
side by the McFarland and Jaques league, and on the Sutherly side by 500 acres
of land part of same league sold by Charles Power decd. to Tupper Barton & Taylor.
And I the said Antonette E Roberts do hereby covenant with the said Braman his
heirs & assigns that I am lawfully seized with a fee simple title to the said
land 1428 acres heretofore described & conveyed & that I have perfect right to
sell and convey and dispose the same as I have here done. And I do hereby
warrant and will forever defend the title and possesion of said tract of land
unto him the said William Cheever Braman his heirs or assigns forever, against
the heirs of the said Charles Power and against all other persons legally
claiming or to claim the same or any part thereof. To have & to hold all of said
Fourteen Hundred and twenty eight acres of land unto him the said William C Braman
his heirs or assigns forever. In testimony whereof I hereto subscribe my name as
of the Twenty Second day of May in the year of our Lord one thousand eight hundred
& seventy nine
Witness
No 7.
A E Roberts
The State of Texas.
Washington County
I
I
Before me E Williams a Notary Public in and for
the State and County afore=
418
said, this day appeared Mrs A E Roberts whose identity and she being the person
she purports to be on the face of the foregoing deed was proven to my satis-
faction by the affidavit of JA Lipscomb to me personally well known and she the
said Mrs A E Roberts acknowledged and stated to me that she had executed the
foregoing deed in which her name appears as grantor for the consideration and
purposes therein stated and that she wishes not to retract the same.
-
"L S" To certify which I have hereunto set my hand and notarial seal this
27th day of May A D 1879
HE Williams
Notary Public
Washington Co Texas.
I, J. A. Lipscomb, a resident of said State and County do solemnly swear that
Mrs A E Roberts, whose signature appears to the foregoing deed as grantor is
the identical person she purports to be
Sworn and subscribed to
I
A. Lipscomb.
before me this May 27th. 1879
I
H. E. Williams.
I
Notary Public W. Co.
I
Filed at 10 AM June 1st. 1879
Recorded at 2 PM June 3d. 1879
John L Croom Clerk
By HS Rugeley Deputy
No. 8273. I W Matthews Collr To Wm. D Barbour
Tax sale deed sold for taxes assessed against Mrs A J McLaughlin for the year 1878.
The State of Texas I
County of Matagorda I know all men by these presents That whereas certain taxes
are due the State of Texas and County of Matagorda by Mrs A J McLaughlin as
assessed against her for the year 1878, upon the following described tract or
parcel of land, viz: Grand Tract No. 3, No of Acres 50, which taxes amounted
to the 
sum of Twelve cents, as appears from the tax roll of said County (for the
year 1878. 
And Whereas the time provided by law for the payment of said taxes having
expired, and though demanded 
of the said Mrs A J McLaughlin, by proper legal
notice the same 
remaining unpaid I, I W Matthews Tax collector of Matagorda County,
in compliance with the law, 
and by virtue of the tax roll aforesaid, levied
upon and seized 
certain tract of land, as belonging to the said Mrs A. J.
McLaughlin, and 
hereinafter described to be sold to make the said amount of said tax-
es yet unpaid, together with costs 
accrued, and have advertised the said lands in
the manner and for the time 
provided by law: and whereas, in pursuance with the said
advertisement, I did offer said lands 
for sale at Public Auction at the time,
place, and in the manner
C

Filed at 11 Oclock A M May 29th. 1879
Recorded at 4 Oclock P M May 29" 1879
John L Croom Clk C C M Co.
No. 8272 Antonette Roberts To Wm. C Braman.
deed to part of Dempsy League

Washington County I Know all men by these presents that I Antonette Roberts,
formerly Antonette Power of of the above named State & County for and in
consideration of the sum of Fifty dollars to me in hand paid by Wm. C Braman
of the County of Matagorda in said State the receipt whereof is hereby acknowledged

& conveyed & by these presents do grant bargain sell alienate convey & confirm
unto him the said William C Braman, his heirs & assigns forever, all of the
following described tract of land to wit. Fourteen hundred & Twenty eight acres
of land situated in said Matagorda County being a part of F W Dempsey league
on the east side of the Colorado River, bounded as follows on the Westerly end

side by the McFarland and Jaques league, and on the Sutherly side by 500 acres
of land part of same league sold by Charles Power decd. to Tupper Barton & Taylor.
And I the said Antonette E Roberts do hereby covenant with the said Braman his
heirs & assigns that I am lawfully seized with a fee simple title to the said

Fourteen Hundred and twenty eight acres of land unto him the said William C Braman
his heirs or assigns forever. In testimony whereof I hereto subscribe my name as
of the Twenty Second day of May in the year of our Lord one thousand eight hundred
& seventy nine
Before me E Williams a Notary Public in and for

said, this day appeared Mrs A E Roberts whose identity and she being the person
she purports to be on the face of the foregoing deed was proven to my satis-
faction by the affidavit of JA Lipscomb to me personally well known and she the
said Mrs A E Roberts acknowledged and stated to me that she had executed the
foregoing deed in which her name appears as grantor for the consideration and
purposes therein stated and that she wishes not to retract the same.

"L S" To certify which I have hereunto set my hand and notarial seal this
27th day of May A D 1879

HE Williams
Notary Public
Washington Co Texas.

I, J. A. Lipscomb, a resident of said State and County do solemnly swear that
Mrs A E Roberts, whose signature appears to the foregoing deed as grantor is
the identical person she purports to be

hereinafter described to be sold to make the said amount of said tax-
es yet unpaid, together with costs

for sale at Public Auction at the time,
